Polish Language Courses (lektoraty) provided by the Department of Foreign Languages at the AGH University of Krakow

Polish language courses (lektoraty) are provided by the AGH University of Krakow subject to the provisions of AGH Senate Resolution no. 57/2019 on the principles of teaching foreign languages at the AGH University of Krakow (24 April 2019). 

Uchwała Nr 57/2019 Senatu AGH z dnia 24 kwietnia 2019 r. w sprawie zasad nauki języków obcych w Akademii Górniczo-Hutniczej im. Stanisława Staszica w Krakowie.

According to the resolution, the Department of Foreign Languages (SJO) offers Polish language instruction for students during regular programmes as well as for those participating in student exchange programmes (e.g. Erasmus).

1. Regular students

First-cycle (undergraduate) students are required to complete two semesters of the course, 60 hours each.

The first semester ends with obtaining a  semester  grade ,

The second semester ends with a semester  grade and the final grade .

 The end-of course exam is not compulsory and is offered to students interested in obtaining the SJO AGH Certificate.

 Second-cycle (Master’s) students attend a one-semester, 60-hour course, which ends with a semester  grade and the final grade.

 Regular students are enrolled in the courses at the beginning of a semester. To request enrollment, please contact   dr Worobjew Magdalena. - Head of the German, Romanic and Slavic Languages Section by email at -  
gris@agh.edu.pl

 When enrolling in the language course remember to include your name, surname, as well as the name of your faculty and the preferred level of the course. Polish language courses are available at all levels from A1 to C1.

2. Students from student exchange programmes

 Students including Erasmus + students, attend one semester 
75-hour Polish language course
. The classes end with a course grade  and the final grade, which is calculated as the average of all grades earned throughout the semester and the grade awarded for the final test. 

Students enroll in the courses via the USOS Service. 

SJO AGH also offers Polish language courses for foreign students from double degree programmes or any other student exchange programmes and projects.
